info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 4:56PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Henderson County through 530 PM EDT... At 456 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles west of Hendersonville, or near Etowah, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hendersonville, Mills River, Flat Rock, Etowah, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Dupont State Forest, Valley Hill, Horse Shoe and Tuxedo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
